images.summary: This image provides various schedules related to the foundation of the dairy barn. The base plate schedule includes BP1 and BP2 with specific dimensions and anchor bolt requirements, referencing detail 3/S5. The pier schedule specifies a 12" diameter pier with 25 MPa concrete and reinforcement details, referencing 2/S2. The wall schedule lists different wall types (W1 to W8) with heights, concrete specifications, and reinforcement details, referencing multiple sections (e.g., 1/S6, 2/S6). The footing schedule details F1, a 5'-0" x 5'-0" x 13" thick concrete footing, referencing 2/S2. The anchor schedule specifies A1 and A2 strong tie post brackets, referencing 5/S5 and 2/S2. The legend indicates top of floor and wall heights as 206 and 230, respectively.

AWNING DETAIL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates an awning structure. The awning is supported by a 2x8 ledger secured with (8) #12 x4" screws to each post, and a 2x6 ledger secured with (4) 3 1/2" ARDOX nails each post. The top ledger is fastened with a Simpson Strong-Tie RR connector. The roofing consists of 29 GA. roofing steel with 1x4 strapping and 1/2" plywood sheathing. The awning is framed with 2x6 members spaced at 24 inches on center, supported by hangers. A 2x12 plate is used for panel hardware mounting. The detail is scaled at 1/2" = 1'-0".

images.summary: This plan view shows the layout of the ground floor of a barn, featuring various functional areas such as stalls, utility rooms, and calf pens. The plan includes 24' x 41' pens and multiple stall arrangements, such as 20 stalls at 48 inches, 22 stalls at 48 inches, and so on. The layout also includes a drive-through feed lane and scrape alleys for efficient movement and cleaning. Grid lines L1, L5, L6, and C1 are visible, helping to organize the space. The plan is part of the main floor plan sheet, facilitating efficient use of the barn's interior.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the continuous purlin detail for the roof structure. The metal track is centered over the purlin splice, and ridge and eave purlins are referenced to the plan for the number of rows. All purlin splice locations are aligned with the center of the truss. Metal tracks are installed per plan, and N10HDG nails are used on each side of each splice as specified. The section callout '3/S4' indicates the detail's reference on sheet S4. The scale is noted as N.T.S. (Not to Scale).

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF TRUSS(ES):
1 -- >> CONTRACTOR AND OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2 -- >> DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S), & X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ ENDWALLS @ INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3 -- >> PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURERS DRAWINGS.
4 -- >> PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING @ ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES
5 -- >> THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
SPACING AS SPECIFIED BY BRACE DESIGNER
48'-0" MAXIMUM
STRAPPING OR SHEATHING ON ROOF DECK SPACED AS SPECIFIED BY TRUSS ENGINEER (2x4 Lumber).
2x4 STRUT x 5'-0" LONG @ TOP & BOTTOM WITH TWO OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS WEB MEMBER
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL BRACE TO LATERAL WITH FOUR OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ INTERSECTION OF TRUSS WEB & TRUSS LATERAL
2x4 DIAGONAL "X" BRACE ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF TRUSS AT ENDWALLS & WHERE SPECIFIED ELSEWHERE
ANCHOR 2x4 DIAGONAL "X" ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF WEB WITH TWO OF 3 1/2" NAILS @ EACH TRUSS
BUTT 2x4 LATERALS @ ALL SPLICE LOCATIONS. ENSURE BUTT JOINT IS TIGHT & CENTERED ON TRUSS WEB.
LAP 2x4 DIAGONAL (Min. 2 TRUSSES) TO ENSURE DIAGONAL BRACE EXTENDS COMPLETELY FROM TOP CHORD TO BOTTOM CHORD OF TRUSS. (AS REQUIRED)
ANCHOR DIAGONAL BRACE TO STRUT @ BOTH ENDS WITH FOUR 3 1/2" NAILS
2
S4
LATERAL 'X' BRACE DETAIL
SCALE: 1/8" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail shows the lateral 'X' brace detail for roof trusses. It includes notes for bracing of roof trusses, specifying that contractors must notify manufacturers of any deficiencies. Diagonal bracing is required on all web members needing lateral bracing, with specific spacing and intervals noted on the roof plan. Permanent lateral bracing is to be installed as indicated. The detail specifies the use of 2x4 struts and diagonal braces, with nails for anchoring. The section callout '2/S4' references this detail on sheet S4. The scale is 1/8" = 1'-0".

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF TRUSS(ES):
1 -- >> CONTRACTOR AND OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2 -- >> DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S), & X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ ENDWALLS @ INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3 -- >> PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURERS DRAWINGS.
4 -- >> PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING @ ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES
5 -- >> THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
images.summary: These notes provide instructions for the bracing of roof trusses. Contractors and owners are required to notify manufacturers of any truss deficiencies, including damage or warping. Diagonal bracing is mandated for all web members needing lateral support, with specific spacing and intervals detailed on the roof plan. Permanent lateral bracing is to be installed as indicated. Diagonal bracing should be provided at all discontinuities in lateral bracing. The truss supplier is responsible for designing the trusses for the specified bracing.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the lateral 'X' brace detail for roof trusses. It specifies the use of 2x4 struts and diagonal braces, with nails for anchoring. The spacing is specified by the brace designer, with a maximum of 48'-0". Strapping or sheathing on the roof deck is spaced as specified by the truss engineer. The section callout '2/S4' references this detail on sheet S4. The scale is 1/8" = 1'-0".

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF TRUSSES:
1. PROVIDE 'X' BRACING OF TRUSS LATERALS AS PER MFG SHOP DRAWINGS REVIEWED BY THE PROJECT ENGINEER.
2. SEE DETAIL 2/S4
3. MAKE 2 ADJACENT FRONT (END) AND 2 ADJACENT BACK (END) TRUSSES INTO A TRUSS BLOCK BY CONNECTING THEM TO EACH OTHER WITH 2X6 BLOCKING @ 4'-0" O.C. MAXIMUM SPACING.
4. PROVIDE CONTINUOUS LATERAL BRACING ALONG BOTTOM CHORDS OF TRUSSES TYPICAL EVERY 8TH TRUSS.
5. TYPICAL BRACING SHOWN ON ROOF PLAN.
6. 4/12 PITCHING FARM TRUSSES @ 48" O.C.
7. EVERY TRUSS DIRECTLY ABOVE POST
8. SELF SUPPORTING WALTED GABLE TRUSS
images.summary: This roof plan outlines the layout and design of the roof structure, including trusses, lateral bracing, and purlins. The notes specify the provision of 'X' bracing of truss laterals as per manufacturer shop drawings reviewed by the project engineer, as indicated in 'SEE DETAIL 2/S4'. The plan also details the creation of truss blocks by connecting adjacent front and back trusses with 2x6 blocking at 4'-0" on center maximum spacing. Continuous lateral bracing is to be provided along the bottom chords of trusses, typically every 8th truss. The roof features 4/12 pitching farm trusses spaced at 48 inches on center, with every truss directly above a post. The plan ensures proper load distribution and structural integrity of the roof system.

images.text_verbatim:
OVERHANG PER PLAN
EVERY OTHER TRUSS TO BEAR DIRECTLY TO POST
TRUSSES BETWEEN POSTS SECURE UPLIFT SCAB w/ 10 - 3 1/2" NAILS OR SIMPSON UPLIFT CLIPS
PLATES PER PLAN LET LVL INTO POST + 1 PLATE FOR 6X8 POSTS
CBQGT66-SDS2 SIMPSON STRONG TIE POST BRACKET (GALV.)
O/S OF POST IS FLUSH w/ O/S OF CONCRETE (CURTAIN SIDE ONLY)
5 S5
LINTEL AND COLUMN DETAIL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates the lintel and column connections, focusing on the truss and post interactions. Trusses are designed to bear directly on posts, with uplift scabs secured using 10 - 3 1/2" nails or Simpson uplift clips. Plates are to be installed per plan, with LVL let into the post and an additional plate for 6x8 posts. The CBQGT66-SDS2 Simpson strong tie post bracket (galvanized) is specified for securing posts. The outer side of the post is flush with the outer side of the concrete on the curtain side only. This detail ensures stability and proper load transfer between the roof trusses and supporting columns.

It specifies the use of uplift scabs or Simpson uplift clips, with reference to truss shop drawings reviewed by the project engineer. A note emphasizes that fasteners into treated lumber must be ACQ rated. This detail ensures secure connections and proper load transfer between structural components.

images.summary: This building section (utility) illustrates the vertical relationships and construction details of the barn. It specifies the provision of 'X' bracing of truss laterals as per manufacturer shop drawings, with reference to detail 2/S4. The section includes R40 loosefill insulation and a 6mil poly vapour barrier liner as per client specifications. Venting is to be provided as per OBC by others. Uplift clips are detailed as per truss drawings, typical on both sides. The exterior stud wall is constructed as per plan, with a typical sill assembly including a 1/2" diameter anchor bolt at 48" on center, a sill plate (not ACQ), and a 1/4" sill gasket. The concrete foundation wall is detailed as per plan, with backfill using parent material. This section provides a comprehensive view of the structural framework and insulation details.

STUD POST TO STEEL BEAM DETAIL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates the connection between a stud post and a steel beam. It specifies the use of two plates secured to the beam with 1/2" bolts at 24" on center, with staggered sides of the flange to match the wall top plate or beam width, or as per truss manufacturer requirements. The pre-engineered truss is supported by truss clips per plan. A double top plate is secured to studs with 1/2" plywood sheathing. The steel beam is detailed as per plan, with a 3/8" endplate complete with four 1/2" diameter A325 bolts through studs. The frame is designed to suit, with bearing and full-length studs as per plan. A 1/2" x 5" x 5" angle is fastened with one 1/2" diameter anchor bolt and two 1/2" diameter lag screws. This detail ensures a robust connection between the stud post and steel beam, accommodating structural loads effectively.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the post wall bracing system, focusing on the connection of scabs to posts. The bracing consists of 2x6 or 2x8 members matching the post depth, secured with 18-inch scabs using 20 galvanized 3½-inch common spiral nails. The 2x4 strapping is attached to the brace with four nails. The detail specifies a vertical dimension of 1'-6" for the brace. The drawing is labeled as 'Post Wall Bracing Detail' and is scaled at 1/2" = 1'-0". This detail ensures the structural integrity of the wall by reinforcing the connection between the posts and roof plates.

images.summary: This detail provides a comprehensive view of the steel beam, column, and footing connections. The beams are connected using 3/4" A325 bolts, with specific bolt counts for different beam sizes (e.g., W24 beam requires 6 bolts). The beams feature 3/8" web stiffeners above columns for through beams. The HSS steel post is anchored with a 12" x 12" base plate and four 3/4" anchor bolts. The footing includes compacted granular fill and 15M rebar in each direction as per the footing schedule. The detail is labeled 'Steel Beam, Column, and Footing Detail' and scaled at 1/2" = 1'-0". This detail ensures the structural stability of the framework by detailing the connections between beams, columns, and footings.

Reinforcement consists of 15M continuous rebar at the top and 15M vertical rebar at 24 inches on center embedded into the floor. The gutter wall is a 10-inch by 10-foot concrete wall with 32 MPA strength, reinforced with 15M horizontal rebar at 16 inches on center and 15M vertical rebar at 12 inches on center. The footing is 8 inches thick, with 32 MPA concrete and 15M rebar at 24 inches on center. A water stop is included, and the footing is set on undisturbed soil. The detail also notes a 24-inch by 24-inch opening in the pit wall for a manure pipe, with specific reinforcement around the opening. The drawing scale is 1/2 inch equals 1 foot.

SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates a W3 curb wall, focusing on the structural components and reinforcement. The stud wall is constructed as per the plan, with a sill plate on a 1/4" sill gasket and 1/2" anchor bolts spaced at 48 inches on center. Continuous 15M rebar is placed at the top and at 24 inches on center. An 8-inch poured concrete curb is specified, with its height determined by the owner. Vertical 15M rebar matches the curb height and includes 12-inch hooks at 24 inches on center, alternating directions into the thickened floor. The floor is thickened to 8 inches below the curb, which is 24 inches wide, reinforced with two continuous 15M rebars. The maximum height is 4 feet, as per the plan. The scale of the drawing is 1/2 inch equals 1 foot. This detail is crucial for understanding the construction and reinforcement of the curb wall system.
